Note that the sense of "population" used here is the general sense of a statistical population, and does not imply that the population consists of people. For example, a populationType of Event or NewsArticle could be used. See also Observation, and the data and datasets overview for more details.

name: Researcher
help: Researchers.

name: TrackAction
help:
An agent tracks an object for updates.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimates objects.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimate objects.

name: VisualArtsEvent
help: Event type: Visual arts event.

name: MedicalRiskEstimator
help: Any rule set or interactive tool for estimating the risk of developing a complication or condition.

name: DigitalDocument
help: An electronic file or document.

name: DeliveryEvent
help: An event involving the delivery of an item.

name: LegalForceStatus
help: A list of possible statuses for the legal force of a legislation.

name: MenuItem
help: A food or drink item listed in a menu or menu section.

name: CurrencyConversionService
help: A service to convert funds from one currency to another currency.

name: DDxElement
help: An alternative, closely-related condition typically considered later in the differential diagnosis process along with the signs that are used to distinguish it.

name: RoofingContractor
help: A roofing contractor.

name: RVPark
help: A place offering space for "Recreational Vehicles", Caravans, mobile homes and the like.

name: ChildrensEvent
help: Event type: Children's event.

name: Enumeration
help: Lists or enumerations—for example, a list of cuisines or music genres, etc.

name: SingleFamilyResidence
help: Residence type: Single-family home.

name: MedicalSpecialty
help: Any specific branch of medical science or practice. Medical specialities include clinical specialties that pertain to particular organ systems and their respective disease states, as well as allied health specialties. Enumerated type.

name: SeaBodyOfWater
help: A sea (for example, the Caspian sea).

name: FollowAction
help:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates polled from.

Related actions:

  • BefriendAction: Unlike BefriendAction, FollowAction implies that the connection is not necessarily reciprocal.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, FollowAction implies that the follower acts as an active agent constantly/actively polling for updates.
  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in getting updates from the object.
  • TrackAction: Unlike TrackAction, FollowAction refers to the polling of updates of all aspects of animate objects rather than the location of inanimate objects (e.g. you track a package, but you don't follow it).

name: UserLikes
help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

name: ArchiveComponent
help: An intangible type to be applied to any archive content, carrying with it a set of properties required to describe archival items and collections.

name: Observation
help: Instances of the class Observation are used to specify observations about an entity (which may or may not be an instance of a StatisticalPopulation), at a particular time. The principal properties of an Observation are observedNode, measuredProperty, measuredValue (or median, etc.) and observationDate (measuredProperty properties can, but need not always, be W3C RDF Data Cube "measure properties", as in the lifeExpectancy example). See also StatisticalPopulation, and the data and datasets overview for more details.

name: RentalCarReservation
help:
A reservation for a rental car.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

name: DepartmentStore
help: A department store.

name: WholesaleStore
help: A wholesale store.

name: SkiResort
help: A ski resort.

name: AutomatedTeller
help: ATM/cash machine.

name: Canal
help: A canal, like the Panama Canal.

name: NGO
help: Organization: Non-governmental Organization.

name: SatiricalArticle
help: An Article whose content is primarily [satirical] in nature, i.e. unlikely to be literally true. A satirical article is sometimes but not necessarily also a NewsArticle. ScholarlyArticles are also sometimes satirized.

name: DrugClass
help: A class of medical drugs, e.g., statins. Classes can represent general pharmacological class, common mechanisms of action, common physiological effects, etc.

name: CorrectionComment
help: A comment that corrects CreativeWork.

name: Schedule
help: A schedule defines a repeating time period used to describe a regularly occurring Event. At a minimum a schedule will specify repeatFrequency which describes the interval between occurences of the event. Additional information can be provided to specify the schedule more precisely. This includes identifying the day(s) of the week or month when the recurring event will take place, in addition to its start and end time. Schedules may also have start and end dates to indicate when they are active, e.g. to define a limited calendar of events.

name: OrganizationRole
help: A subclass of Role used to describe roles within organizations.

name: HealthAspectEnumeration
help: HealthAspectEnumeration enumerates several aspects of health content online, each of which might be described using hasHealthAspect and HealthTopicContent.

name: Distance
help: Properties that take Distances as values are of the form '<Number> <Length unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 ft'.

name: FMRadioChannel
help: A radio channel that uses FM.

name: MusicPlaylist
help: A collection of music tracks in playlist form.

name: MotorizedBicycle
help: A motorized bicycle is a bicycle with an attached motor used to power the vehicle, or to assist with pedaling.

name: TVSeries
help: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

name: Nerve
help: A common pathway for the electrochemical nerve impulses that are transmitted along each of the axons.

name: Float
help: Data type: Floating number.

name: DataType
help: The basic data types such as Integers, Strings, etc.

name: PerformingArtsTheater
help: A theater or other performing art center.

name: BedDetails
help: An entity holding detailed information about the available bed types, e.g. the quantity of twin beds for a hotel room. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you can use bed directly with a text. See also BedType (under development).

name: XPathType
help: Text representing an XPath (typically but not necessarily version 1.0).

name: QuantitativeValue
help: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

name: AcceptAction
help:
The act of committing to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

  • RejectAction: The antonym of AcceptAction.

name: MensClothingStore
help: A men's clothing store.

name: Language
help: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in BCP 47 can be used via the alternateName property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using ComputerLanguage.

name: MediaGallery
help: Web page type: Media gallery page. A mixed-media page that can contains media such as images, videos, and other multimedia.

name: SaleEvent
help: Event type: Sales event.

name: NightClub
help: A nightclub or discotheque.

name: Brewery
help: Brewery.

name: Answer
help: An answer offered to a question; perhaps correct, perhaps opinionated or wrong.

name: GovernmentService
help: A service provided by a government organization, e.g. food stamps, veterans benefits, etc.

name: DataCatalog
help: A collection of datasets.

name: ConfirmAction
help:
The act of notifying someone that a future event/action is going to happen as expected.

Related actions:

  • CancelAction: The antonym of ConfirmAction.

name: ParentAudience
help: A set of characteristics describing parents, who can be interested in viewing some content.

name: AdvertiserContentArticle
help: An Article that an external entity has paid to place or to produce to its specifications. Includes advertorials, sponsored content, native advertising and other paid content.

name: NewsArticle
help:
A NewsArticle is an article whose content reports news, or provides background context and supporting materials for understanding the news.

A more detailed overview of schema.org News markup is also available.

name: ShortStory
help: Short story or tale. A brief work of literature, usually written in narrative prose.

name: DrugCostCategory
help: Enumerated categories of medical drug costs.

name: BackgroundNewsArticle
help: A NewsArticle providing historical context, definition and detail on a specific topic (aka "explainer" or "backgrounder"). For example, an in-depth article or frequently-asked-questions (FAQ) document on topics such as Climate Change or the European Union. Other kinds of background material from a non-news setting are often described using Book or Article, in particular ScholarlyArticle. See also NewsArticle for related vocabulary from a learning/education perspective.

name: ParcelDelivery
help: The delivery of a parcel either via the postal service or a commercial service.

name: TheaterGroup
help: A theater group or company, for example, the Royal Shakespeare Company or Druid Theatre.

name: BoardingPolicyType
help: A type of boarding policy used by an airline.

name: MedicalSignOrSymptom
help: Any feature associated or not with a medical condition. In medicine a symptom is generally subjective while a sign is objective.

name: PublicSwimmingPool
help: A public swimming pool.

name: FundingAgency
help:
A FundingAgency is an organization that implements one or more FundingSchemes and manages the granting process (via Grants, typically MonetaryGrants). A funding agency is not always required for grant funding, e.g. philanthropic giving, corporate sponsorship etc.

Examples of funding agencies include ERC, REA, NIH, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation...

name: 3DModel
help: A 3D model represents some kind of 3D content, which may have encodings in one or more MediaObjects. Many 3D formats are available (e.g. see Wikipedia); specific encoding formats can be represented using the encodingFormat property applied to the relevant MediaObject. For the case of a single file published after Zip compression, the convention of appending '+zip' to the encodingFormat can be used. Geospatial, AR/VR, artistic/animation, gaming, engineering and scientific content can all be represented using 3DModel.

name: GovernmentBenefitsType
help: GovernmentBenefitsType enumerates several kinds of government benefits to support the COVID-19 situation. Note that this structure may not capture all benefits offered.

name: InviteAction
help: The act of asking someone to attend an event. Reciprocal of RsvpAction.

name: RadioChannel
help: A unique instance of a radio BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

name: PerformingGroup
help: A performance group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a circus.

name: MediaObject
help: A media object, such as an image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

name: Cemetery
help: A graveyard.

name: JobPosting
help: A listing that describes a job opening in a certain organization.

name: MusicReleaseFormatType
help: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, ie. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

name: Duration
help: Quantity: Duration (use ISO 8601 duration format).

name: Airport
help: An airport.

name: BrainStructure
help: Any anatomical structure which pertains to the soft nervous tissue functioning as the coordinating center of sensation and intellectual and nervous activity.

name: BedAndBreakfast
help:
Bed and breakfast.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

name: EventStatusType
help: EventStatusType is an enumeration type whose instances represent several states that an Event may be in.

name: CheckInAction
help:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their arrival by registering/confirming for a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or at a place (e.g. hotel), possibly resulting in a result (boarding pass, etc).

Related actions:

  • CheckOutAction: The antonym of CheckInAction.
  • ArriveAction: Unlike ArriveAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service.
  • ConfirmAction: Unlike ConfirmAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service rather than its validity/existence.

name: House
help: A house is a building or structure that has the ability to be occupied for habitation by humans or other creatures (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House).

name: LodgingBusiness
help: A lodging business, such as a motel, hotel, or inn.

name: RecyclingCenter
help: A recycling center.

name: WPAdBlock
help: An advertising section of the page.

name: Hospital
help: A hospital.

name: Festival
help: Event type: Festival.

name: Ticket
help: Used to describe a ticket to an event, a flight, a bus ride, etc.

name: PhysicalActivity
help: Any bodily activity that enhances or maintains physical fitness and overall health and wellness. Includes activity that is part of daily living and routine, structured exercise, and exercise prescribed as part of a medical treatment or recovery plan.

name: StatusEnumeration
help: Lists or enumerations dealing with status types.

name: Reservation
help:
Describes a reservation for travel, dining or an event. Some reservations require tickets.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, restaurant reservations, flights, or rental cars, use Offer.

name: ArchiveOrganization
help: An organization with archival holdings. An organization which keeps and preserves archival material and typically makes it accessible to the public.

name: FindAction
help:
The act of finding an object.

Related actions:

  • SearchAction: FindAction is generally lead by a SearchAction, but not necessarily.

name: MortgageLoan
help: A loan in which property or real estate is used as collateral. (A loan securitized against some real estate.)

name: RadioSeason
help: Season dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

name: ClothingStore
help: A clothing store.

name: LegalValueLevel
help: A list of possible levels for the legal validity of a legislation.

name: MedicalDevice
help: Any object used in a medical capacity, such as to diagnose or treat a patient.

name: PsychologicalTreatment
help: A process of care relying upon counseling, dialogue and communication  aimed at improving a mental health condition without use of drugs.

name: UpdateAction
help: The act of managing by changing/editing the state of the object.

name: Legislation
help: A legal document such as an act, decree, bill, etc. (enforceable or not) or a component of a legal act (like an article).

name: AggregateRating
help: The average rating based on multiple ratings or reviews.

name: MonetaryAmountDistribution
help: A statistical distribution of monetary amounts.

name: IndividualProduct
help: A single, identifiable product instance (e.g. a laptop with a particular serial number).

name: PostalCodeRangeSpecification
help: Indicates a range of postalcodes, usually defined as the set of valid codes between postalCodeBegin and postalCodeEnd, inclusively.

name: EmailMessage
help: An email message.

name: BusStation
help: A bus station.

name: MedicalEntity
help: The most generic type of entity related to health and the practice of medicine.

name: GeoCoordinates
help: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

name: HobbyShop
help: A store that sells materials useful or necessary for various hobbies.

name: AutomotiveBusiness
help: Car repair, sales, or parts.

name: MiddleSchool
help: A middle school (typically for children aged around 11-14, although this varies somewhat).

name: BowlingAlley
help: A bowling alley.

name: ImageGallery
help: Web page type: Image gallery page.

name: Offer
help:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

Note: As the businessFunction property, which identifies the form of offer (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose), defaults to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell; an Offer without a defined businessFunction value can be assumed to be an offer to sell.

For GTIN-related fields, see Check Digit calculator and validation guide from GS1.

name: Product
help: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

name: SocialEvent
help: Event type: Social event.

name: EatAction
help: The act of swallowing solid objects.

name: LearningResource
help:
The LearningResource type can be used to indicate CreativeWorks (whether physical or digital) that have a particular and explicit orientation towards learning, education, skill acquisition, and other educational purposes.

LearningResource is expected to be used as an addition to a primary type such as Book, Video, Product etc.

EducationEvent serves a similar purpose for event-like things (e.g. a Trip). A LearningResource may be created as a result of an EducationEvent, for example by recording one.

name: SpecialAnnouncement
help:
A SpecialAnnouncement combines a simple date-stamped textual information update with contextualized Web links and other structured data. It represents an information update made by a locally-oriented organization, for example schools, pharmacies, healthcare providers, community groups, police, local government.

For work in progress guidelines on Coronavirus-related markup see this doc.

The motivating scenario for SpecialAnnouncement is the Coronavirus pandemic, and the initial vocabulary is oriented to this urgent situation. Schema.org expect to improve the markup iteratively as it is deployed and as feedback emerges from use. In addition to our usual Github entry, feedback comments can also be provided in this document.

While this schema is designed to communicate urgent crisis-related information, it is not the same as an emergency warning technology like CAP, although there may be overlaps. The intent is to cover the kinds of everyday practical information being posted to existing websites during an emergency situation.

Several kinds of information can be provided:

We encourage the provision of "name", "text", "datePosted", "expires" (if appropriate), "category" and "url" as a simple baseline. It is important to provide a value for "category" where possible, most ideally as a well known URL from Wikipedia or Wikidata. In the case of the 2019-2020 Coronavirus pandemic, this should be "https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2019-20_coronavirus_pandemic" or "https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q81068910".

For many of the possible properties, values can either be simple links or an inline description, depending on whether a summary is available. For a link, provide just the URL of the appropriate page as the property's value. For an inline description, use a WebContent type, and provide the url as a property of that, alongside at least a simple "text" summary of the page. It is unlikely that a single SpecialAnnouncement will need all of the possible properties simultaneously.

We expect that in many cases the page referenced might contain more specialized structured data, e.g. contact info, openingHours, Event, FAQPage etc. By linking to those pages from a SpecialAnnouncement you can help make it clearer that the events are related to the situation (e.g. Coronavirus) indicated by the category property of the SpecialAnnouncement.

Many SpecialAnnouncements will relate to particular regions and to identifiable local organizations. Use spatialCoverage for the region, and announcementLocation to indicate specific LocalBusinesses and CivicStructures. If the announcement affects both a particular region and a specific location (for example, a library closure that serves an entire region), use both spatialCoverage and announcementLocation.

The about property can be used to indicate entities that are the focus of the announcement. We now recommend using about only for representing non-location entities (e.g. a Course or a RadioStation). For places, use announcementLocation and spatialCoverage. Consumers of this markup should be aware that the initial design encouraged the use of /about for locations too.

The basic content of SpecialAnnouncement is similar to that of an RSS or Atom feed. For publishers without such feeds, basic feed-like information can be shared by posting SpecialAnnouncement updates in a page, e.g. using JSON-LD. For sites with Atom/RSS functionality, you can point to a feed with the webFeed property. This can be a simple URL, or an inline DataFeed object, with encodingFormat providing media type information e.g. "application/rss+xml" or "application/atom+xml".

name: LiteraryEvent
help: Event type: Literary event.

name: RepaymentSpecification

name: GamePlayMode
help: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.

name: BroadcastService
help: A delivery service through which content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

name: TheaterEvent
help: Event type: Theater performance.

name: TakeAction
help:
The act of gaining ownership of an object from an origin. Reciprocal of GiveAction.

Related actions:

  • GiveAction: The reciprocal of TakeAction.
  • ReceiveAction: Unlike ReceiveAction, TakeAction implies that ownership has been transfered.

name: AMRadioChannel
help: A radio channel that uses AM.

name: InteractAction
help: The act of interacting with another person or organization.

name: Permit
help: A permit issued by an organization, e.g. a parking pass.

name: AutoBodyShop
help: Auto body shop.

name: BroadcastEvent
help: An over the air or online broadcast event.

name: Zoo
help: A zoo.

name: HomeGoodsStore
help: A home goods store.

name: LakeBodyOfWater
help: A lake (for example, Lake Pontrachain).

name: School
help: A school.

name: TelevisionStation
help: A television station.

name: SpeakableSpecification
help: A SpeakableSpecification indicates (typically via xpath or cssSelector) sections of a document that are highlighted as particularly speakable. Instances of this type are expected to be used primarily as values of the speakable property.

name: PaymentService
help: A Service to transfer funds from a person or organization to a beneficiary person or organization.

name: RefundTypeEnumeration
help: RefundTypeEnumeration enumerates several kinds of product return refund types.

name: ShippingRateSettings
help: A ShippingRateSettings represents re-usable pieces of shipping information. It is designed for publication on an URL that may be referenced via the shippingSettingsLink property of an OfferShippingDetails. Several occurrences can be published, distinguished and matched (i.e. identified/referenced) by their different values for shippingLabel.

name: RadiationTherapy
help: A process of care using radiation aimed at improving a health condition.

name: Beach
help: Beach.

name: HowToItem
help: An item used as either a tool or supply when performing the instructions for how to to achieve a result.

name: BodyOfWater
help: A body of water, such as a sea, ocean, or lake.

name: RadioSeries
help: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

name: PathologyTest
help: A medical test performed by a laboratory that typically involves examination of a tissue sample by a pathologist.

name: ComicSeries
help:
A sequential publication of comic stories under a
        unifying title, for example "The Amazing Spider-Man" or "Groo the
        Wanderer".

name: MusicVideoObject
help: A music video file.

name: MarryAction
help: The act of marrying a person.

name: AnalysisNewsArticle
help: An AnalysisNewsArticle is a NewsArticle that, while based on factual reporting, incorporates the expertise of the author/producer, offering interpretations and conclusions.

name: MedicalBusiness
help: A particular physical or virtual business of an organization for medical purposes. Examples of MedicalBusiness include differents business run by health professionals.

name: GeneralContractor
help: A general contractor.

name: TravelAction
help: The act of traveling from an fromLocation to a destination by a specified mode of transport, optionally with participants.

name: ShareAction
help: The act of distributing content to people for their amusement or edification.

name: WPHeader

name: IceCreamShop
help: An ice cream shop.

name: Notary
help: A notary.

name: ReactAction
help: The act of responding instinctively and emotionally to an object, expressing a sentiment.

name: DeactivateAction
help: The act of stopping or deactivating a device or application (e.g. stopping a timer or turning off a flashlight).

name: FastFoodRestaurant
help: A fast-food restaurant.

name: DataFeedItem
help: A single item within a larger data feed.

name: InvestmentOrDeposit
help: A type of financial product that typically requires the client to transfer funds to a financial service in return for potential beneficial financial return.

name: Message
help: A single message from a sender to one or more organizations or people.

name: DryCleaningOrLaundry
help: A dry-cleaning business.

name: GeospatialGeometry
help: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

name: VoteAction
help: The act of expressing a preference from a fixed/finite/structured set of choices/options.

name: BookFormatType
help: The publication format of the book.

name: Barcode
help: An image of a visual machine-readable code such as a barcode or QR code.

name: Consortium
help: A Consortium is a membership Organization whose members are typically Organizations.

name: LoanOrCredit
help: A financial product for the loaning of an amount of money under agreed terms and charges.

name: OrderStatus
help: Enumerated status values for Order.

name: SocialMediaPosting
help: A post to a social media platform, including blog posts, tweets, Facebook posts, etc.

name: Park
help: A park.

name: SuperficialAnatomy
help: Anatomical features that can be observed by sight (without dissection), including the form and proportions of the human body as well as surface landmarks that correspond to deeper subcutaneous structures. Superficial anatomy plays an important role in sports medicine, phlebotomy, and other medical specialties as underlying anatomical structures can be identified through surface palpation. For example, during back surgery, superficial anatomy can be used to palpate and count vertebrae to find the site of incision. Or in phlebotomy, superficial anatomy can be used to locate an underlying vein; for example, the median cubital vein can be located by palpating the borders of the cubital fossa (such as the epicondyles of the humerus) and then looking for the superficial signs of the vein, such as size, prominence, ability to refill after depression, and feel of surrounding tissue support. As another example, in a subluxation (dislocation) of the glenohumeral joint, the bony structure becomes pronounced with the deltoid muscle failing to cover the glenohumeral joint allowing the edges of the scapula to be superficially visible. Here, the superficial anatomy is the visible edges of the scapula, implying the underlying dislocation of the joint (the related anatomical structure).

name: ExhibitionEvent
help: Event type: Exhibition event, e.g. at a museum, library, archive, tradeshow, ...

name: DrugStrength
help: A specific strength in which a medical drug is available in a specific country.

name: RentAction
help: The act of giving money in return for temporary use, but not ownership, of an object such as a vehicle or property. For example, an agent rents a property from a landlord in exchange for a periodic payment.

name: MedicalRiskCalculator
help: A complex mathematical calculation requiring an online calculator, used to assess prognosis. Note: use the url property of Thing to record any URLs for online calculators.

name: EmployeeRole
help: A subclass of OrganizationRole used to describe employee relationships.

name: CategoryCode
help: A Category Code.

name: ItemListOrderType
help: Enumerated for values for itemListOrder for indicating how an ordered ItemList is organized.

name: ComedyClub
help: A comedy club.

name: SurgicalProcedure
help: A medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed for diagnose, or therapeutic purposes.

name: MedicalClinic
help: A facility, often associated with a hospital or medical school, that is devoted to the specific diagnosis and/or healthcare. Previously limited to outpatients but with evolution it may be open to inpatients as well.

name: StructuredValue
help: Structured values are used when the value of a property has a more complex structure than simply being a textual value or a reference to another thing.

name: MedicalEvidenceLevel
help: Level of evidence for a medical guideline. Enumerated type.

name: RadioClip
help: A short radio program or a segment/part of a radio program.

name: AgreeAction
help: The act of expressing a consistency of opinion with the object. An agent agrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

name: EmploymentAgency
help: An employment agency.

name: PrependAction
help: The act of inserting at the beginning if an ordered collection.

name: Play
help: A play is a form of literature, usually consisting of dialogue between characters, intended for theatrical performance rather than just reading. Note the peformance of a Play would be a TheaterEvent - the Play being the workPerformed.

name: FireStation
help: A fire station. With firemen.

name: CourseInstance
help: An instance of a Course which is distinct from other instances because it is offered at a different time or location or through different media or modes of study or to a specific section of students.

name: Hotel
help:
A hotel is an establishment that provides lodging paid on a short-term basis (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hotel).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

name: ComicCoverArt
help: The artwork on the cover of a comic.

name: MobileApplication
help: A software application designed specifically to work well on a mobile device such as a telephone.

name: AskPublicNewsArticle
help: A NewsArticle expressing an open call by a NewsMediaOrganization asking the public for input, insights, clarifications, anecdotes, documentation, etc., on an issue, for reporting purposes.

name: ReviewNewsArticle
help: A NewsArticle and CriticReview providing a professional critic's assessment of a service, product, performance, or artistic or literary work.

name: Intangible
help: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.

name: ElectronicsStore
help: An electronics store.

name: BefriendAction
help:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone (object) mutually/bidirectionally/symmetrically.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, BefriendAction implies that the connection is reciprocal.

name: TVClip
help: A short TV program or a segment/part of a TV program.

name: NailSalon
help: A nail salon.

name: ServiceChannel
help: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

name: BloodTest
help: A medical test performed on a sample of a patient's blood.

name: CarUsageType
help: A value indicating a special usage of a car, e.g. commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi.

name: Book
help: A book.

name: SpreadsheetDigitalDocument
help: A spreadsheet file.

name: AlignmentObject
help:
An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

Should not be used where the nature of the alignment can be described using a simple property, for example to express that a resource teaches or assesses a competency.

name: DrinkAction
help: The act of swallowing liquids.

name: ContactPoint
help: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

name: FinancialService
help: Financial services business.

name: VideoObject
help: A video file.

name: MedicalGuideline
help: Any recommendation made by a standard society (e.g. ACC/AHA) or consensus statement that denotes how to diagnose and treat a particular condition. Note: this type should be used to tag the actual guideline recommendation; if the guideline recommendation occurs in a larger scholarly article, use MedicalScholarlyArticle to tag the overall article, not this type. Note also: the organization making the recommendation should be captured in the recognizingAuthority base property of MedicalEntity.

name: Menu
help: A structured representation of food or drink items available from a FoodEstablishment.

name: GovernmentBuilding
help: A government building.

name: EmergencyService
help: An emergency service, such as a fire station or ER.

name: Property
help: A property, used to indicate attributes and relationships of some Thing; equivalent to rdf:Property.

name: EnergyConsumptionDetails
help: EnergyConsumptionDetails represents information related to the energy efficiency of a product that consumes energy. The information that can be provided is based on international regulations such as for example EU directive 2017/1369 for energy labeling and the Energy labeling rule under the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (EPCA) in the US

name: PhotographAction
help: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.

name: HealthAndBeautyBusiness
help: Health and beauty.

name: CssSelectorType
help: Text representing a CSS selector.

name: Periodical
help:
A publication in any medium issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended, such as a magazine, scholarly journal, or newspaper to continue indefinitely.

See also blog post.

name: Electrician
help: An electrician.

name: Series
help: A Series in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. See also CreativeWorkSeries, EventSeries.

name: MediaManipulationRatingEnumeration
help: (editorial work in progress, this definition is incomplete and unreviewed) MediaManipulationRatingEnumeration classifies a number of ways in which a media item (video, image, audio) can be manipulated, taking into account the context within which they are published or presented.

name: CreativeWorkSeason
help: A media season e.g. tv, radio, video game etc.

name: VideoGameSeries
help: A video game series.

name: HealthPlanFormulary
help: For a given health insurance plan, the specification for costs and coverage of prescription drugs.

name: WearAction
help: The act of dressing oneself in clothing.

name: CoverArt
help: The artwork on the outer surface of a CreativeWork.

name: MedicalConditionStage
help: A stage of a medical condition, such as 'Stage IIIa'.

name: TravelAgency
help: A travel agency.

name: UserCheckins
help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

name: LegislativeBuilding
help: A legislative building—for example, the state capitol.

name: BoatReservation
help:
A reservation for boat travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

name: Patient
help: A patient is any person recipient of health care services.

name: SuspendAction
help: The act of momentarily pausing a device or application (e.g. pause music playback or pause a timer).

name: VideoGallery
help: Web page type: Video gallery page.

name: Bone
help: Rigid connective tissue that comprises up the skeletal structure of the human body.

name: Quantity
help: Quantities such as distance, time, mass, weight, etc. Particular instances of say Mass are entities like '3 Kg' or '4 milligrams'.

name: EducationalAudience
help: An EducationalAudience.

name: Hostel
help:
A hostel - cheap accommodation, often in shared dormitories.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

name: CreditCard
help:
A card payment method of a particular brand or name. Used to mark up a particular payment method and/or the financial product/service that supplies the card account.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#AmericanExpress
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DinersClub
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Discover
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#JCB
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#MasterCard
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#VISA

name: FundingScheme
help: A FundingScheme combines organizational, project and policy aspects of grant-based funding that sets guidelines, principles and mechanisms to support other kinds of projects and activities. Funding is typically organized via Grant funding. Examples of funding schemes: Swiss Priority Programmes (SPPs); EU Framework 7 (FP7); Horizon 2020; the NIH-R01 Grant Program; Wellcome institutional strategic support fund. For large scale public sector funding, the management and administration of grant awards is often handled by other, dedicated, organizations - FundingAgencys such as ERC, REA, ...

name: MovingCompany
help: A moving company.

name: Question
help: A specific question - e.g. from a user seeking answers online, or collected in a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document.

name: RadioBroadcastService
help: A delivery service through which radio content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

name: ComedyEvent
help: Event type: Comedy event.

name: DonateAction
help: The act of providing goods, services, or money without compensation, often for philanthropic reasons.

name: Brand
help: A brand is a name used by an organization or business person for labeling a product, product group, or similar.

name: EventSeries
help:
A series of Events. Included events can relate with the series using the superEvent property.

An EventSeries is a collection of events that share some unifying characteristic. For example, "The Olympic Games" is a series, which is repeated regularly. The "2012 London Olympics" can be presented both as an Event in the series "Olympic Games", and as an EventSeries that included a number of sporting competitions as Events.

The nature of the association between the events in an EventSeries can vary, but typical examples could include a thematic event series (e.g. topical meetups or classes), or a series of regular events that share a location, attendee group and/or organizers.

EventSeries has been defined as a kind of Event to make it easy for publishers to use it in an Event context without worrying about which kinds of series are really event-like enough to call an Event. In general an EventSeries may seem more Event-like when the period of time is compact and when aspects such as location are fixed, but it may also sometimes prove useful to describe a longer-term series as an Event.

name: BusStop
help: A bus stop.

name: UserComments
help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

name: ReviewAction
help: The act of producing a balanced opinion about the object for an audience. An agent reviews an object with participants resulting in a review.

name: HotelRoom
help:
A hotel room is a single room in a hotel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

name: Audiobook
help: An audiobook.

name: LocationFeatureSpecification
help: Specifies a location feature by providing a structured value representing a feature of an accommodation as a property-value pair of varying degrees of formality.

name: Pharmacy
help: A pharmacy or drugstore.

name: BarOrPub
help: A bar or pub.

name: PaintAction
help: The act of producing a painting, typically with paint and canvas as instruments.

name: SportsActivityLocation
help: A sports location, such as a playing field.

name: AssessAction
help: The act of forming one's opinion, reaction or sentiment.

name: WarrantyPromise
help: A structured value representing the duration and scope of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

name: Order
help: An order is a confirmation of a transaction (a receipt), which can contain multiple line items, each represented by an Offer that has been accepted by the customer.

name: Reservoir
help: A reservoir of water, typically an artificially created lake, like the Lake Kariba reservoir.

name: ScholarlyArticle
help: A scholarly article.

name: MedicalOrganization
help: A medical organization (physical or not), such as hospital, institution or clinic.

name: EmployerAggregateRating
help: An aggregate rating of an Organization related to its role as an employer.

name: Event
help: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the offers property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

name: Role
help:
Represents additional information about a relationship or property. For example a Role can be used to say that a 'member' role linking some SportsTeam to a player occurred during a particular time period. Or that a Person's 'actor' role in a Movie was for some particular characterName. Such properties can be attached to a Role entity, which is then associated with the main entities using ordinary properties like 'member' or 'actor'.

See also blog post.

name: MedicalIntangible
help: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things in the medical space.

name: EventAttendanceModeEnumeration
help: An EventAttendanceModeEnumeration value is one of potentially several modes of organising an event, relating to whether it is online or offline.

name: City
help: A city or town.

name: ConsumeAction
help: The act of ingesting information/resources/food.

name: BankOrCreditUnion
help: Bank or credit union.

name: Mosque
help: A mosque.

name: DriveWheelConfigurationValue
help: A value indicating which roadwheels will receive torque.

name: AdultEntertainment
help: An adult entertainment establishment.

name: DrugPregnancyCategory
help: Categories that represent an assessment of the risk of fetal injury due to a drug or pharmaceutical used as directed by the mother during pregnancy.

name: VitalSign
help: Vital signs are measures of various physiological functions in order to assess the most basic body functions.

name: CreateAction
help: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.

name: ScheduleAction
help:
Scheduling future actions, events, or tasks.

Related actions:

  • ReserveAction: Unlike ReserveAction, ScheduleAction allocates future actions (e.g. an event, a task, etc) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

name: ScreeningEvent
help: A screening of a movie or other video.

name: ArriveAction
help: The act of arriving at a place. An agent arrives at a destination from a fromLocation, optionally with participants.

name: MusicEvent
help: Event type: Music event.

name: MonetaryAmount
help: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use PriceSpecification Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

name: Store
help: A retail good store.

name: HairSalon
help: A hair salon.

name: DaySpa
help: A day spa.

name: TherapeuticProcedure
help: A medical procedure intended primarily for therapeutic purposes, aimed at improving a health condition.

name: DiscoverAction
help: The act of discovering/finding an object.

name: EndorsementRating
help:
An EndorsementRating is a rating that expresses some level of endorsement, for example inclusion in a "critic's pick" blog, a "Like" or "+1" on a social network. It can be considered the result of an EndorseAction in which the object of the action is rated positively by some agent. As is common elsewhere in schema.org, it is sometimes more useful to describe the results of such an action without explicitly describing the Action.

An EndorsementRating may be part of a numeric scale or organized system, but this is not required: having an explicit type for indicating a positive, endorsement rating is particularly useful in the absence of numeric scales as it helps consumers understand that the rating is broadly positive.

name: ElementarySchool
help: An elementary school.

name: ReplaceAction
help: The act of editing a recipient by replacing an old object with a new object.

name: MedicalTherapy
help: Any medical intervention designed to prevent, treat, and cure human diseases and medical conditions, including both curative and palliative therapies. Medical therapies are typically processes of care relying upon pharmacotherapy, behavioral therapy, supportive therapy (with fluid or nutrition for example), or detoxification (e.g. hemodialysis) aimed at improving or preventing a health condition.

name: EnergyStarEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration
help: Used to indicate whether a product is EnergyStar certified

name: EngineSpecification
help: Information about the engine of the vehicle. A vehicle can have multiple engines represented by multiple engine specification entities.

name: ActivateAction
help: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g. starting a timer or turning on a flashlight).

name: RadioEpisode
help: A radio episode which can be part of a series or season.

name: TieAction
help: The act of reaching a draw in a competitive activity.

name: Corporation
help: Organization: A business corporation.

name: DislikeAction
help: The act of expressing a negative sentiment about the object. An agent dislikes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

name: FAQPage
help: A FAQPage is a WebPage presenting one or more "Frequently asked questions" (see also QAPage).

name: PlayAction
help:
The act of playing/exercising/training/performing for enjoyment, leisure, recreation, Competition or exercise.

Related actions:

  • ListenAction: Unlike ListenAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to performing for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming music.
  • WatchAction: Unlike WatchAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to showing/displaying for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming visual content.

name: ItemList
help: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

name: Winery
help: A winery.

name: InformAction
help: The act of notifying someone of information pertinent to them, with no expectation of a response.

name: MedicalScholarlyArticle
help: A scholarly article in the medical domain.

name: MedicalAudienceType
help: Target audiences types for medical web pages. Enumerated type.

name: ReturnAction
help: The act of returning to the origin that which was previously received (concrete objects) or taken (ownership).

name: ReportedDoseSchedule
help: A patient-reported or observed dosing schedule for a drug or supplement.

name: BoatTrip
help: A trip on a commercial ferry line.

name: Chapter
help: One of the sections into which a book is divided. A chapter usually has a section number or a name.

name: DiagnosticProcedure
help: A medical procedure intended primarily for diagnostic, as opposed to therapeutic, purposes.

name: JoinAction
help:
An agent joins an event/group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, JoinAction refers to joining a group/team of people.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be receiving updates.
  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be polling for updates.

name: RiverBodyOfWater
help: A river (for example, the broad majestic Shannon).

name: MeetingRoom
help:
A meeting room, conference room, or conference hall is a room provided for singular events such as business conferences and meetings (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conference_hall).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

name: OrderAction
help: An agent orders an object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

name: Drawing
help: A picture or diagram made with a pencil, pen, or crayon rather than paint.

name: CatholicChurch
help: A Catholic church.

name: EventVenue
help: An event venue.

name: WriteAction
help: The act of authoring written creative content.

name: MovieClip
help: A short segment/part of a movie.

name: MusicAlbumProductionType
help: Classification of the album by it's type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

name: MerchantReturnPolicy
help: A MerchantReturnPolicy provides information about product return policies associated with an Organization or Product.

name: HVACBusiness
help: A business that provide Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning services.

name: SearchAction
help:
The act of searching for an object.

Related actions:

  • FindAction: SearchAction generally leads to a FindAction, but not necessarily.

name: ProductModel
help: A datasheet or vendor specification of a product (in the sense of a prototypical description).

name: TaxiStand
help: A taxi stand.

name: Collection
help: A collection of items e.g. creative works or products.

name: PodcastSeries
help: A podcast is an episodic series of digital audio or video files which a user can download and listen to.

name: Class
help: A class, also often called a 'Type'; equivalent to rdfs:Class.

name: TrainTrip
help: A trip on a commercial train line.

name: BrokerageAccount
help: An account that allows an investor to deposit funds and place investment orders with a licensed broker or brokerage firm.

name: Landform
help: A landform or physical feature.  Landform elements include mountains, plains, lakes, rivers, seascape and oceanic waterbody interface features such as bays, peninsulas, seas and so forth, including sub-aqueous terrain features such as submersed mountain ranges, volcanoes, and the great ocean basins.

name: Episode
help: A media episode (e.g. TV, radio, video game) which can be part of a series or season.

name: SoftwareSourceCode
help: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

name: Locksmith
help: A locksmith.

name: BeautySalon
help: Beauty salon.

name: TrainReservation
help:
A reservation for train travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

name: MusicVenue
help: A music venue.

name: OceanBodyOfWater
help: An ocean (for example, the Pacific).

name: LibrarySystem
help: A LibrarySystem is a collaborative system amongst several libraries.

name: TelevisionChannel
help: A unique instance of a television BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

name: MedicalTest
help: Any medical test, typically performed for diagnostic purposes.

name: PostalAddress
help: The mailing address.

name: Motorcycle
help: A motorcycle or motorbike is a single-track, two-wheeled motor vehicle.

name: PhysicalActivityCategory
help: Categories of physical activity, organized by physiologic classification.

name: HealthPlanCostSharingSpecification
help: A description of costs to the patient under a given network or formulary.

name: DrugCost
help: The cost per unit of a medical drug. Note that this type is not meant to represent the price in an offer of a drug for sale; see the Offer type for that. This type will typically be used to tag wholesale or average retail cost of a drug, or maximum reimbursable cost. Costs of medical drugs vary widely depending on how and where they are paid for, so while this type captures some of the variables, costs should be used with caution by consumers of this schema's markup.

name: WarrantyScope
help:
A range of of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Labor-BringIn
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-BringIn
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-PickUp

name: CollegeOrUniversity
help: A college, university, or other third-level educational institution.

name: ClaimReview
help: A fact-checking review of claims made (or reported) in some creative work (referenced via itemReviewed).
